content.description: User's choice, you can either climb the face of the arete or squeeze into the offwidth on the right.
content.location:
Find the wide crack to the left of

Daddy Didn't Need No Magnum

.

content.description: It definitely was quite dirty and not very long, but this could clean up to be a decent route. It has a high first bolt, and I felt the crux was getting off the ground.
content.location:
This route is just to the left of "

Old School

, 5.9", on MP or "Where The Buffalo Roam, 5.9". in the guidebook.

content.description: Snail Trail is another fun route. It is well-protected.
content.location:
Access: Hike left from

Natural Born Drilla

along the cliff base. Walk past

Evil Empire

, and scramble up and over the pedestal.

Drilla From Manilla

and

Snail Trail

start near one another at at a relatively flat belay stance.  The start is just left and below the pillar.

See the

The Prow topo.

for location.

content.description: This has solid stone and really fun climbing. It is a tad run out in a couple of spots, particularly to the anchors. That being said, this route has been the first 5.9 lead for at least two climbers, with no complaints from either one. No FA beta is available, so I've taken the liberty to give the route a name more interesting than "un-named". If anyone has FA beta, let me know.
content.protection: 7 bolts, hangers and anchors are welded cold shuts.
content.location:
Hike left from

Natural Born Drilla

along the cliff base. Walk past

Evil Empire

, and scramble up and over the pedestal. The Un-named 5.9 is about 20 feet left of

Drilla From Manilla

and

Snail Trail

.

content.description:
This shares the start with

Drill for the Thrill

, then it heads right. It stays a bit cruxy for three bolts at mid route.
content.location:
See the

The Prow topo.

for location.

content.description: Start on a lieback flake. The crux is in the lower section of the route. We did this route back in 2010.
content.location:
This is just left of

Born On The Fourth

, which starts just around the corner. Rappel the route with a single rope.

content.description:
This route hits you right off the ground with a stout boulder problem, which is reachy from bolt 1 to 2 to get to the right hand pocket. Power your way past this first bulge, and crawl into a no-hands rest up and left in the shallow, right-facing corner. You get a major rest here, but it's not over until you climb through the thin, back-to-back 5.12 sequences towards the top.

This route is a fun 12c if you aid past the first crux and start in the no-hands rest that is just left of the 5th bolt.

Condition update: the opening crux is a bit harder now that a hold has broken
content.location:
Start under the short, overhanging bulge just right of

Evil Empire

.

content.description: Shorty, quality route that climbs good limestone with one definite crux.
content.location:
This is route #7 on Nate's topo. Located between

Snail Trail

and

Old School

.

content.description:
Start under the big roof. The first couple bolts are on vertical rock - you'll find the crux here. The route underclings, liebacks, and stems to the anchors. The rock quality deteriorates as the route goes vertical, but the climbing is easy and well protected. Wear a helmet and have fun!

See the

The Prow topo.

for location.

content.location:
Access: there is a climber's trail just below

Drill for the Thrill

. Please follow this to the base of the crag, then traverse left. This means a couple of extra steps but will save the talus slope from erosion.

The start is just left and below the pillar in the middle of the Prow.

See the

The Prow topo.

for location.

content.description: Battle your way through the bush at the base. Climb easy rock foreplay to the third bolt, clip this, and you have the protection needed for the bulge ahead of you. Make 5.9+ moves for the next three bolts, and reach the climax of the climb at the anchor. As with all routes in the area, there is some loose rock left of the route.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the Prow.

content.description:
This is on the buttress just right of

Drilla From Manilla

.  Start at the top of the pillar that splits The Prow in two.
content.location:
This is right of

Drilla From Manilla

and left of

Evil Empire

.

content.description:
Drill for the Thrill shares the start with

Natural Born Drilla

. The steep crux is about mid-route.

See the

The Prow topo.

.
Start climbing on the east side of the buttress, and after the second bolt, go left and climb the south face. It has a lot of different types of climbing from thin face to fun, steep, jug hauling.
content.location:
This route is on the right south-facing buttress of the Prow-50 feet right of

Natural Born Drilla

. First route you come to as approaching the rock from the east (parking lot).

climbs.name: The 16 Men of Tain
climbs.fa: Joe Schultz, Celin Serbo, DJ Nechrony, Chris Tarbet, 2011

content.description:
Since everything on the left side of the Prow is easier, you might expect this one to follow suit. Not so. It gets stiffer and stiffer as you get higher, so don't be fooled into warming up here, or you'll be climbing

Daddy

to get back that 7th or 8th draw.

(I don't know what the official rating is; this was just a guess, to dissuade fools like me from warming up, and there likely is a more proper name, but some punks have scratched this phrase into the rocks.)

Eds. The name has been updated.
content.location:
This is 100 feet past

Old School

, just right of

Daddy

.
